storyTitle: As Project Manager, I want to view real-time task status reports to track project progress and identify delays

testCases.title: View real-time task status report with filters
preconditions: User is logged in with Project Manager role
Task management system contains active tasks with various statuses
At least one task is overdue and one task is blocked
User has authorization to access task status reporting module

steps.action: Navigate to task status reporting module from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Task status report UI is displayed with default view showing all tasks, filter options are visible including project, assignee, and status dropdowns

steps.action: Select a specific project from the project filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Project filter is applied, report refreshes within 3 seconds showing only tasks belonging to the selected project

steps.action: Select a specific assignee from the assignee filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Assignee filter is applied in addition to project filter, report refreshes within 3 seconds showing only tasks assigned to the selected user within the selected project

steps.action: Verify the display of task statuses in the report
steps.expectedResult: All filtered tasks are displayed with accurate real-time status information including task name, assignee, due date, current status, and progress indicators

steps.action: Verify visual alerts for overdue tasks
steps.expectedResult: Overdue tasks are highlighted with distinct visual indicators (red color, warning icon, or similar) making them easily identifiable

steps.action: Verify visual alerts for blocked tasks
steps.expectedResult: Blocked tasks are highlighted with distinct visual indicators (amber color, blocked icon, or similar) clearly differentiating them from other tasks

postconditions: Task status report displays filtered results accurately
Overdue and blocked tasks are visually highlighted
Report data reflects real-time task statuses
Filters remain applied for subsequent interactions

testCases.title: Export task status report to PDF and Excel
preconditions: User is logged in with Project Manager role
Task status reporting module is accessible
Task data is available in the system
User has export permissions
Browser allows file downloads

steps.action: Navigate to task status reporting module and apply desired filters (project and assignee)
steps.expectedResult: Task status report is displayed with filtered data showing relevant tasks with accurate status information

steps.action: Click on the 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file generation process initiates, download prompt appears, and PDF file is downloaded to the default download location

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens successfully displaying the task status report with all filtered data, visual formatting is preserved, overdue and blocked tasks are highlighted, all columns and data are accurate and match the on-screen report

steps.action: Return to the task status report and click on the 'Export to Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Excel file generation process initiates, download prompt appears, and Excel file (.xlsx or .xls) is downloaded to the default download location

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens successfully with task status report data in tabular format, all columns are properly formatted, data is accurate and matches the on-screen report, overdue and blocked tasks are identifiable through formatting or separate columns

steps.action: Verify data accuracy in both exported files against the on-screen report
steps.expectedResult: Both PDF and Excel exports contain 100% accurate data matching the filtered report displayed on screen, including task names, assignees, due dates, statuses, and visual indicators for overdue/blocked tasks

postconditions: PDF file is successfully downloaded and contains accurate report data
Excel file is successfully downloaded and contains accurate report data
Both exported files are accessible and readable
Original report view remains unchanged on screen

testCases.title: Subscribe to task status report notifications
preconditions: User is logged in with Project Manager role
Task status reporting module is accessible
User has a valid email address configured in the system
Notification service is operational
User has subscription management permissions

steps.action: Navigate to task status reporting module
steps.expectedResult: Task status report UI is displayed with subscription options visible

steps.action: Click on 'Subscription Settings' or 'Subscribe to Reports' button
steps.expectedResult: Subscription configuration UI is displayed showing options for frequency (daily, weekly, monthly), report filters, delivery format (PDF, Excel), and email preferences

steps.action: Select subscription frequency as 'Daily'
steps.expectedResult: Daily frequency option is selected and highlighted

steps.action: Configure report filters by selecting specific project and status criteria
steps.expectedResult: Selected filters are applied to the subscription configuration, preview shows what data will be included in scheduled reports

steps.action: Select delivery format as 'PDF and Excel'
steps.expectedResult: Both PDF and Excel format options are selected for report delivery

steps.action: Enter or verify email address for report delivery
steps.expectedResult: Email address field displays the correct email address where reports will be sent

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Subscribe' button
steps.expectedResult: Subscription is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed stating 'Subscription saved successfully' or similar, subscription appears in the list of active subscriptions

steps.action: Wait for the scheduled report delivery time (simulate or wait for actual delivery based on test environment)
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received at the configured email address at the scheduled time

steps.action: Open the received email notification
steps.expectedResult: Email contains task status report as attachments in both PDF and Excel formats, email body includes summary information and links to access the full report online

steps.action: Download and verify the attached report files
steps.expectedResult: Both PDF and Excel attachments open successfully, contain accurate task status data matching the configured filters, and display overdue/blocked task highlights

postconditions: Subscription is active and saved in the system
User receives scheduled email notifications with report attachments
Subscription can be viewed and managed in subscription settings
Report data in notifications is accurate and up-to-date

storyTitle: As Project Manager, I want to receive notifications for overdue tasks to enable timely interventions

testCases.title: Receive notification for overdue task
preconditions: User is logged in with Project Manager role
Task management system is operational
Notification service is enabled and functional
User has a valid email address configured
User has permissions to receive overdue task notifications
System time is synchronized and accurate

steps.action: Create a new task with a due date set to a past date (e.g., yesterday)
steps.expectedResult: Task is created successfully with past due date, task appears in the task list, system automatically marks the task status as 'overdue' based on the past due date

steps.action: Wait for the notification processing cycle (maximum 1 minute as per performance requirements)
steps.expectedResult: System detects the overdue task through real-time monitoring, notification generation process is triggered

steps.action: Check email inbox for overdue task notification
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received within 1 minute of task becoming overdue, email subject clearly indicates overdue task alert, email body contains task details including task name, due date, assignee, and current status

steps.action: Check in-app notifications panel or notification center
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is displayed in the notification center, notification shows overdue task information with visual indicator (red badge or similar), notification timestamp is accurate

steps.action: Click on the task details link provided in the email notification
steps.expectedResult: Browser opens and navigates directly to the task details page, user is authenticated automatically or redirected to login if session expired, task details page displays complete information about the overdue task

steps.action: Click on the in-app notification
steps.expectedResult: Application navigates to the task details page, task details are displayed with all relevant information including task name, description, assignee, due date, current status, and overdue indicator

steps.action: Verify the accuracy of task information in the notification against actual task data
steps.expectedResult: All task details in the notification match the actual task data in the system with 100% accuracy, due date comparison is correct, overdue status is accurately reflected

postconditions: Overdue task notification is successfully delivered via email and in-app
Notification links provide direct access to task details
Task remains marked as overdue in the system
Notification is logged in the notification history
Project Manager can take corrective action based on the notification

testCases.title: Manage notification subscription preferences
preconditions: User is logged in with Project Manager role
Notification system is operational
User has access to notification settings
At least one overdue task exists or can be created for testing
User has valid email address configured

steps.action: Navigate to user profile or settings menu
steps.expectedResult: Settings menu is displayed with options including notification preferences or subscription settings

steps.action: Click on 'Notification Settings' or 'Subscription Preferences'
steps.expectedResult: Notification subscription UI is displayed showing various notification types including overdue task notifications, each notification type has toggle or checkbox controls for email and in-app notifications

steps.action: Locate the 'Overdue Task Notifications' section
steps.expectedResult: Overdue task notification preferences are displayed with separate controls for email notifications and in-app notifications, current subscription status is clearly indicated (enabled or disabled)

steps.action: Disable email notifications for overdue tasks by unchecking or toggling off the email option
steps.expectedResult: Email notification toggle changes to disabled state, visual indicator shows email notifications are turned off

steps.action: Keep in-app notifications enabled for overdue tasks
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification toggle remains in enabled state

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Update Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: Preferences are saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed stating 'Notification preferences updated successfully' or similar, page reflects the updated settings

steps.action: Create a new task with past due date or wait for an existing task to become overdue
steps.expectedResult: Task is marked as overdue by the system

steps.action: Wait for notification processing (up to 1 minute)
steps.expectedResult: System processes the overdue task detection

steps.action: Check email inbox for overdue task notification
steps.expectedResult: No email notification is received for the overdue task, confirming that email notifications are successfully disabled

steps.action: Check in-app notification center
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification for the overdue task is displayed, confirming that in-app notifications remain enabled and functional

steps.action: Return to notification subscription settings and enable email notifications for overdue tasks
steps.expectedResult: Email notification toggle changes to enabled state, settings are saved successfully

steps.action: Create another task with past due date or modify an existing task to become overdue
steps.expectedResult: Task is marked as overdue

steps.action: Wait for notification processing and verify both email and in-app notifications are received
steps.expectedResult: Both email notification and in-app notification are received for the overdue task, confirming that re-enabling email notifications works correctly and notification behavior matches the updated preferences

postconditions: Notification subscription preferences are saved correctly
Email notifications are suppressed when disabled
In-app notifications continue to function when enabled
Re-enabling notifications restores full notification functionality
User has control over notification delivery channels

storyTitle: As Project Manager, I want to export task status reports to Excel for detailed analysis

testCases.title: Export task status report to Excel
preconditions: User is logged in as Project Manager with authorized access
Task status report data exists in the system with at least 10 records
User has permissions to export reports
Browser supports file downloads
System API endpoint POST /api/reports/taskstatus/export is available

steps.action: Navigate to the task status reports section
steps.expectedResult: Task status reports page is displayed with available report options

steps.action: Select filters or parameters for the task status report (date range, project, status)
steps.expectedResult: Selected filters are applied and highlighted in the UI

steps.action: Click on 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and displays the task status report with columns including task name, status, assignee, due date, priority, and completion percentage

steps.action: Verify the report data is displayed correctly on screen
steps.expectedResult: Report is displayed with accurate data matching the selected filters, all columns are visible and properly aligned

steps.action: Locate and click on 'Export to Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Export process initiates, progress indicator or loading spinner is displayed

steps.action: Wait for export processing to complete
steps.expectedResult: Export completes within 10 seconds, success message is displayed, and Excel file download begins automatically

steps.action: Check the downloaded file location and verify file name format (e.g., TaskStatusReport_YYYY-MM-DD.xlsx)
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is downloaded successfully to the default download folder with proper naming convention including timestamp

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file using Microsoft Excel or compatible spreadsheet application
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens without errors or corruption warnings

steps.action: Verify the Excel file structure: check that all columns from the report are present (task name, status, assignee, due date, priority, completion percentage)
steps.expectedResult: All columns are present in the Excel file with proper headers in the first row

steps.action: Verify data accuracy by comparing at least 5 sample records from the Excel file with the original report displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: Data in Excel file matches exactly with the data displayed in the original report

steps.action: Check formatting: verify column widths are appropriate, headers are bold, dates are formatted correctly, and percentages display with % symbol
steps.expectedResult: Excel file maintains proper formatting with readable column widths, bold headers, correct date format (MM/DD/YYYY or system default), and percentage values formatted with % symbol

steps.action: Verify that all rows from the report are exported (check row count excluding header)
steps.expectedResult: Total number of data rows in Excel matches the record count shown in the original report

postconditions: Excel file is successfully downloaded and saved to local system
Original report remains displayed on screen unchanged
Export action is logged in system audit trail
User can perform additional exports or navigate away from the page
Downloaded Excel file can be opened, edited, and shared offline
